text: Where do you think that bird came from?
There's an old tale of a giant condor that roosts at an abandoned reactor on a remote island.
I've heard that story, but there's no way to reach that island anymore.
An island, huh... Well, there's nothing we can do about it then.
Yeah, let's head to Junon first.
No, there's a small village beneath the fortress city.
Under Junon. A neglected fishing village.
The burden of Shinra's oppression falls on them. It's the same everywhere.
If you want to rest, go to Under Junon.
Head along the coast to reach Under Junon.
Welcome to Under Junon, the village without sunlight.
I am Rhonda, the mayor and chief of security.
I could report you... If I'm right, that's 100,000 gil.
Sorry, but that's not gonna happen.
But you know, we're pretty good at turning a blind eye.
This isn't a trap, is it?
If you knew the history of this town, you'd understand.
If you don't like it, then leave.
It's pretty much empty. Make yourself at home.
Have any guys in black cloaks come through?
There were some in black suits, though. Two men and a woman.
They went up with that elevator.
You probably already know this, but upstairs is Shinra's fortress city, Junon.
The elevator is for Shinra personnel only.
Apparently, there's something going on up there, so security is tightened and the soldiers are on edge.
If you cause any trouble and get the village involved, I won't forgive you.
Don't worry, I won't call the cops.
So, what now? No sign of anyone in black capes.
It depends on where they're headed.
If they're leaving this area, as far as I know, the only options are by sea or by air.
Let's split up and gather information.
We should ask if we can get a boat here or if there are any other ways.
And I'm curious about where those in black capes went.
Shall we meet back at the inn when we're finished?
Long ago, the capital of the Republic of Junon was located in this ocean.
It was a floating city made up of countless interconnected ships.
This glorious maritime city was sunk by a Shinra attack.
On the land overlooking the sea, Shinra built an unsinkable steel city.
It stands like a gravestone for the Republic... or so they say.
This is a fishing village, so of course there are boats.
But there's been an order from above prohibiting fishing, and it's indefinite.
With the condition that we don't involve the villagers, it seems tough to borrow a boat.
They say that back in the day, you could catch big ones just by going out a bit offshore.
But ever since the underwater mako reactor was built, only monsters show up. The fish are all gone.
Shinra messed up the sea too.
I heard Shinra's hosting a big event up on the plate.
I wonder what it could be.
People in the village are angry about the lack of sunlight.
So, you know, I feel kinda guilty for finding it cozy here.
It looks like we have no choice but to use that elevator to get to the upper city.
It's heavily guarded. We should avoid getting too close.

Excuse me, sir
judging by the sword on your back, I have a favor to ask.

The voice earlier belongs to a girl named Priscilla from our village.
Could you please go and help her?
Yuffie, hold on to the dolphin!
Blow that monster away, like you did with the reactor!
First, we need to secure her airway.
Maybe we should call a doctor from upstairs?
Her body temperature is dropping. We have to hurry.
Damn it! Isn't there anyone who can help?!
Hey! Give me a hand, will you?
What do you think you're doing, creep?!
They had a different approach and left Avalanche over it.
These people are my guests. They helped save your life.
Ugh, sorry about that. You helped me and I called you a creep. I'm such an idiot!
Come on, Yuffie. Let's get you to your room to rest.
I hate to say it, but kids these days...
Another guest. Whenever the world gets chaotic, I get more customers.
Monsters like that have been appearing more frequently every year. It's all because of the mako reactor.
You really saved us. On behalf of the village, thank you.

Thank you so much, you guys!
You were all so cool!
I'm Priscilla. Nice to meet you!
Mr. Dolphin says thank you too!
Hey, you guys are with the Avalanche splinter group, right?

I really respect you guys.
Way more than the main branch!

Hey, can we meet up later?
I have a favor to ask.
And I gotta thank you too! Right? Right?
Alright... come to the inn tomorrow.
There are people like that, always pretending to be respectful.
Well, she's still just a kid. We'll handle it appropriately.
Anyway, let's head to the inn.
Hey, I heard you were the heroes of the hour at the beach.
Rodner told me to make sure you're well taken care of.
So, would four rooms be alright?
Could you make it five, please?
Oh, don't worry about the cost. Consider it a thank you for helping Priscilla.
Well then, let's take it easy today.
The room is a bit small, but please make yourself comfortable.
It's been a while since we've had this many rooms booked.
Hey, about that Yuffie girl we saved earlier. She mentioned having a request.
What do you think it is?
What do you think Yuffie's request is?
Ah, the burden of being popular!
Good thing I practiced for moments like this.
Want me to give you an autograph too?
Maybe she wants to join Avalanche.
I'd love to say we don't turn anyone away, but...
We've got no time or patience to babysit a kid right now.
Guess we'll just have to let her down gently.
Or she might be planning to report us to Shinra.
She's a scam artist, huh? I'll have to give her a lecture.
But I can't believe they've got wanted posters of us up already.
If anything comes up, I'll let you know. You get some rest.
Wait! I tried to stop it, but there was nothing I could do.
Yeah, it felt like that. They were forcibly taken from me.
I just know that something is missing.
But I have no idea what it is... It's so frustrating.
You must be tired. Take a good rest.
It hasn't been that long since we left Midgar, but it feels like we've come so far.
I wonder how Mom and Marlene are doing.
Do you want to go back?
There's no time. We have to go after Sephiroth.
Hey, do you remember the first time we met?
Do you remember the first time we met?
You shoved a flower at me.
You forced a flower on me.
I was giving you a gift.
I saw that flower in a vase at Seventh Heaven. Though I think it was Tifa who put it there.
I don't think giving a gift from one girl to another is a good idea.
Keep that in mind for next time.
Nope, that was the second time.
It was fun, walking on the rooftops together.
No way! Remember, I gave you a flower.
Oh, really... Well, that's just like you, Cloud.
I wonder where those people in the black cloaks went.
What could that event happening up there be?
Perfect timing. I was just about to go to your room.
I want to apologize for what happened in Kalm.
Hey, do you remember Emilio from Nibelheim?
Do you remember Emilio from Nibelheim?
The only person I remember is Tifa.
The general store owner's son, right?
The only person I remember is Tifa.
You know, from the general store family.
Oh... Well, you know the general store owner's son?
Emilio left the village just a bit before you did.
I hadn't seen him since then, but last year, he came to Seventh Heaven.
He said he rarely comes to the slums. He seemed a bit different.
Yeah, and he was with this girl who was incredibly beautiful...
Not really. But if you want to talk about it, I'll listen.
But maybe it ended up that way. I'm sorry.

Next time, we'll have a proper talk.
We'll get our answers.
Next time, let's have an honest talk.
You should rest in your room too, Cloud.
This town is overwhelmed by the smell of the sea.
With the scent so strong, we might not notice if Shinra shows up.
We might not notice Shinra's scent.
Though my nose might fail, my ears are still sharp. I'll alert you if I hear anything suspicious.
My nose is tingling. It's really annoying.
I never planned on counting on you anyway.
Hmph. Fine, I'll go get some sleep then.
Would you like to rest in the bed?

I've come from far away to fight the wicked Shinra Company.
I am a descendant of the shinobi clan!
So, that favor I mentioned yesterday...
How about teaming up with me?
I always thought I should work with a splinter group rather than the main faction.
A ninja's job... isn't it spying or assassination?
That's not the kind of stuff we do, though.
But this time, you might be right.
Little Yuffie, far away from her homeland Wutai,
bravely continues her anti-Shinra mission, earning her own funds along the way.
And while I was looking for a way to earn here, I met Rhonda the village chief.
She said there’s an assassination job on the table.
The bold move on Shinra Company's new president...
He’s coming to Junon any minute now.
It looks like he’s getting a fancy inauguration parade.
These people have hated Shinra ever since their country and their sunlight were taken from them.

Too bad, looks like you've already been sold.
I know you're there, my friend!
I'll ask Priscilla how to get to the upper level.
I'll leave the rest to you!
If you don’t come out soon, I'll crash in with my bike! You wouldn't want that, my friend!
We're at a disadvantage indoors. Let's head outside.
Still not coming out? Hurry up and show your face.
I can't wait any longer, my friend!
Don't stay up there, come closer.
Hahaha, still playing hard to get, I see.
I've got some good news for you.
I've been selected for a special mission to rescue Aerith.
That's what I came to tell you.
Hahahaha! I just stopped by to say hi this time.
this place is a bit too small.
We both don't want to leave this unresolved, right?
I've prepared the perfect stage up above.
I'll be waiting for you up there, my friend!
He seems like a real pain.
We should probably get out of here. We don't want to cause more trouble for the village.
If we're going topside, we should rely on Priscilla. That's what Yuffie said, right?
You sold us out! Don't think we'll let it slide.
Here, it's not much, but take it.
It's your bounty... well, part of it.
I always intended to give you a share.
No point in us anti-Shinra folks fighting each other, right?
What if we really got caught!?
Then I would've handled it somehow. But it worked out, didn't it?
Now we just have to hope Yuffie can manage her part.
You know, all the materia in my house has disappeared.
It seems like someone stole it.
I wasn't able to use it well anyway, so it's not such a big deal, but still...
I don't want to jump to conclusions, but it was probably Yuffie.
Huh? Priscilla? She was by the coast last time I saw her.
We want to go up. Yuffie said to ask you.
I'm so happy! Leave it to me!
Actually, Yuffie's the one who found it.
She said using that ship is the easiest way to get to Junon.
Look, that control room up there can operate the ship.
Someone needs to go to the control room and lower the ship.
Then the rest of us can get on and be lifted up.
The problem is how to get to the control room.
Yep. There's an electric current to keep intruders from climbing.
Ain't no way we're getting through that.
That's where Mr. Dolphin comes in!
Mr. Dolphin is amazing, you know. Umm...
Oh! Want to hear the story of how I met Mr. Dolphin?
You see, I was swimming in the sea when I heard this squeaky sound...
Sorry, but we're in a hurry.
We'll come back as soon as we're done, I promise. You can tell us all about Mr. Dolphin then, okay?
Like this, see? Like this, and then this!
So, what do we do next?
We'll ask Mr. Dolphin to help you jump!
With his help, you'll definitely reach it.
So, who wants to get launched by Mr. Dolphin?
Alright then, let me know when you're ready.

Do you want to go up?
(You won't be able to return to Under Junon for a while)
Would you like to try again?
The dolphin will take you to the ship.
Take care, mister, miss, and doggy!
Let's meet up at the top!
Are they preparing for the parade?
They don't have time to worry about us.
Still, this place is vast. Finding those in black cloaks will be tough.
They don't seem to be here. Let's head into town.
Shinra's pride and joy—the latest, fastest airship.
Forget the boat, let's take that!
Only a few can fly an airship like that.
I see, that's a bit disappointing.
Let's go into town and look for a boat.
No. Keep an eye on them.

He says he is Colonel Glenn Lodbrok.
Let's get straight to the point, President Rufus.
Can I assume you'll be carrying out the plans that the viceroy and your father devised?
The next era's theme will be the struggle over the Huge Materia.
By having Shinra and Wutai clash with each other in various places, we'll maintain tensions.
But with the President dead, the situation has changed.
You always did love your plans, didn't you, young master...
Do you still believe in that fairy-tale promised land?
You Shinras only think about extracting Mako.
If you don't give back sometimes, the planet will be ruined.
War brings anger, sadness, and hatred, but it also brings unparalleled unity and excitement.
It rouses the world, and that spirit revitalizes the planet.
We're doing this for the future of the planet. Let's go right up to the brink of catastrophe.
You're not a kid anymore. We can't have you stopping whenever you feel like it.
Oh, I almost forgot. There's a message from Governor Sfoul.
Congratulations on becoming the president. Wishing you continued success.
Cloud, do you know a lot about Junon?
This is a military city with an underground mako reactor.
In times of emergency, the entire city becomes a fortress and takes on the role of defending against enemies from the sea.
It's also a hub for air and sea routes, making it the second most important city to Shinra after Midgar.
Wow. What about good food or tourist spots?
I figured. That's so you, Cloud.
Aerith, you don't think we're here for sightseeing, do ya?
Alright, listen up! The president's commendation will go to us, Midgar's Seventh Infantry!
and show those Junon forces how it's done!
Now, take a break until the parade begins!
Use this time to review your formations!
Those guys earlier... Think they're marching in the parade?
More like trying to impress their new boss.
I kept quiet ‘cause I knew this’d be a big deal, but I just can't hold it in.
Rufus is right here in town, and we're just gonna let this chance slip by?
I ain't saying we assassinate the guy—but we should at least have a word. Maybe rough him up a little, y'know?
First, the Turks tell us they're not after us anymore.
Then Cloud's biker friend shows up talking about 'protecting' us. We need some answers.
We can’t exactly walk up to the president on the street.
No, that’s how we end up riddled with bullets like a bunch of idiots. The city's crawling with Shinra troops.
We join the parade. Blend in.
Get in, get close, get answers—without making a scene.
Barret, Red—you guys find a route to the port and check out the security situation.
And keep an eye out for anyone in black robes while you're at it.
You two won’t blend in without proper disguises.
Alright, I’m off. First, gotta find a uniform.
I am so ready for this!
If you haven't changed into your uniforms, we have spares pressed and ready in this room.
Is there anyone who hasn't changed yet?
Are you participating in the parade?
There's a uniform in the room, so please change quickly.

Aren't we going to disguise ourselves?
We haven't changed yet, have we?
So, this is how it looks!
Okay, step back three paces, please!
Cloud, you might be a bit too close.
No, it's also about how you act and speak. Just follow my lead from here on out.
The parade venue is in Upper Junon.
Make sure to head there early so you aren't late for the event.
You weren't at the drills. Don't tell me you were late?
Do you have any idea how important this parade is!?
Get inside now! Your movements will be checked by the commander.
If you make even a single mistake...
I'll feed you to a Behemoth!
I remember the routine. Just copy me.
Stop mumbling and get in there! The commander is waiting!

You've got some nerve being late to the drill.
You must be pretty confident in yourselves.
Fine. Let's see what you got.
One mistake and I'll toss you right into a malboro's waiting mouth.
Are you ready? Then let's begin!
Are you ready? Then let's begin!
Those precise, clean movements... Steady as a rock.
Do you take us for fools?!
How about making him the parade leader?
Effective immediately, I'm appointing you as the captain of Midgar's Seventh Infantry!
It's an important role where you'll set an example by leading the parade.
Remember, whether we receive the company award or not is all up to you.
Alright, first of all, you need to gather the soldiers of our unit currently in Junon.

They're all wearing the armbands of the Midgar Seventh Infantry Regiment.

Tardiness will not be tolerated, so take your mission seriously.
We're counting on you, got it?

With the little free time they have, some may be out shopping.

Tifa: We're gathering the troops in town, right?

I hope our full-effort march can inspire those who were affected.

It's true, though they haven't told me my assignment yet.
I see. Then let's make some great memories together!
Excuse us, but we're in the middle of an important discussion.
Apologies, sir! I didn’t realize you were the captain!
Sigh... I really messed up and held the senior back. And the Chief might have seen it too...

But because of the treaty with Wutai, we haven't fired it in years, right?
I love it. A huge weapon that's forbidden to use—it really has a certain romance to it!
What is it? We're in the middle of something here.
I'll lead you to the parade grounds. Everyone, follow me.
Hey, where's the new president been all this time?

Let's show him what we’re capable of.

All of us hope to celebrate the inauguration of our new president, Rufus, with the best performance possible.

Midgar is currently facing tough times.
We march carrying all of your hopes.

Oh, you're the captain? I apologize!
May I have a moment of your time for a quick interview?
It's predicted to be a fierce battle in the upcoming parade. Do you have any special tactics?
Wow... As expected of the captain.
If we talk about our strategy, it won't be a strategy anymore.
Break time's over. We're heading to the parade grounds. Follow me.
Hello there. Could I have a moment of your time?
Yes. Are you here to see the parade today?
No, I'm just here on a business trip, but of course I'll be watching the parade.
It's a major event for our company, after all.
Today is also the inauguration of President Rufus.
What's your impression of the new president?
Even though he's young, he has leadership, elegance, and dignity.
Most importantly, he embodies the Shinra spirit.
From now on, all of us employees are determined to firmly support the new president.
Um...is this being broadcast in Midgar too?
Then, can I say a few words to my daughter?
Hey there, can you see me? It's Daddy!
Daddy's in Junon right now for work.
Oh, yeah, I saw the mako cannon.
It was many times bigger than I imagined.
I really wanted to see it together with the family.

I'll bring back lots of souvenirs, so listen to Mommy and make sure to study, okay?

Um, we're running out of time.
Just as expected from the stronghold city Junon! They've got some seriously practical weapons.
But our goal is... you know?

It's been my dream to put this together.
Do you want the limited edition too?
Look at the helmet, you idiot!
Break time is over. Head outside.
Move a bit more toward the center, everyone.

Uh, can I take a closer look?

Captain, it's almost time for the event.
